start.text: Hello, Sentient Ship, how may I help you?

name.text: My name is Agent Lawrence Lessig.
name.label: Lawrence Lessig

job.text: I am the station agent here at Outpost Station.
job.label: Station Agent

Outpost Station.text: It's the last edge of Human territory.  Anything beyond the station is under Trad control.

territory.text: Territory is an area of land that belongs to or is controlled by a government.

Trad.text: The Trad are an evil race of aliens.  They'll attack you on site if they see you.  Of course, you could always attack them, if you want to earn a bounty.

Repair.text: I can repair you, one credit for 5 points of HP.

Decline repair.text: If you need a repair, just ask.

Accept repair.text: Here you go, all fixed up.

text: I'm paying a bounty right now.  Communications are detecting a Trad scout ship.  I need you to drive it away with your laser blasters.  I'll pay you 5 credits if you succeed.
I'm paying another bounty right now.  I'm detecting a couple of Trad scout ships this time. I'll pay you 5 more credits if you succeed.
I'm paying another bounty right now.  I'm detecting two more Trad scout ships on the border with Alpha sector.  I'll pay you 5 more credits if you succeed.
I'm paying another bounty right now.  Now I've got a squadron of three Trad scout ships on the edge of Delta sector.  This time I suppose it's fair I pay you 10 credits if you succeed.
I'm paying another bounty right now.  I've got another squadron, this time, with a nasty Trad attack fighter and two scout ships.  If you can drive them away, I'll pay you 30 credits.
summaryText: Drive away a Trad Scout
Drive away two Trad Scouts; attempt to disable individually

Drive away two Trad scouts; one Trad fighter

decline.text: Talk to me again if you're interested in a bounty.

text: Alright.  It's just a small ship, but they can be nasty.  Don't worry.  I can repair any damage you sustain - for a fee, of course.  Come back when you're done and I'll pay you the credits.
I suggest disabling them one at a time.  That way you can limit the damage you receive.
Watch out!  One of them has a hacking array.  If you get hit with it, you won't be able to use your weapons system for a while.
At least they didn't bring an attack fighter with them.  I'll see you when you get back.
One more thing - I'll give you access to the station's entire comm array.  You can make some new friends!
accept.defaultText: Everyone appreciates the work you do around here, Sentient Ship.

text: I'm a little surprised you survived the battle.  A deal's a deal!  Here are the credits I promised.
I'm pretty impressed.  You may be little, but you're pretty tough!  Here are your credits!
Those hacking arrays can be pretty nasty.  Good job!  Here are your credits!
It's not so easy taking on three of those scouts at once.  Here are your credits!

That big one was pretty tough!  I didn't expect the two scouts would each be armed with a torpedo.  They have unlimited range!  Now that you have access to the station's comm system, you'll be able to find out about adding other weapons systems, like torpedoes, to your ship, as well as upgrading your weapons and defense systems. Here are the credits I promised.  I'll always have a bounty available, and you can always come to me to repair your damage.  Explore the station's comm system to talk to the other interesting characters who inhabit this outpost.  Good luck!  This quadrant isn't exactly known as a quiet and calm neighborhood, but you can't beat the view!

goodbye.text: Take care of yourself Sentient Ship.  Don't take any hacked credits!

start.text: Hello, Sentient Ship, Agent Lessig told me all about you.

job.text: I am the engineer here at Outpost Station.
job.label: Engineer

engineer.text: I have a variety of tasks as the stations's engineer.  I maintain station systems, defend the station from Trad attack, and upgrade and install torpedos in trusted ships.

systems.text: Thanks to the station's artificial intelligence systems, there really isn't much for me to do on a daily basis.  My real responsibility is in case some tragedy occurs.

artificial intelligence.text: A.I. means machines machines that have human like intelligence, like you, sentient ship.

tragedy.text: This part of the quadrant is pretty wild, so you never know what's going to pop up.  Just last week I found some comet tail worms eating the fiber optics in the comm array.

comet.text: A comet is an object in outer space that develops a long, bright tail when it passes near a star.

worms.text: The trad consider them a delicacy.

defend.text: The station is constantly under attack from the Trad.  In fact, even a lightly armed ship like yourself could earn a decent living in credits from running bounties, defending station systems from Trad attack.

trusted.text: Intergalactic Federation rules say that I can't install or upgrade torpedo systems in any ship that hasn't been certified as friendly.

friendly.text: I can certify a ship as friendly, but it's a complicated series of tests.  It's pretty expensive.  Maybe we could talk after I really get to know you.

start.text: Sentient ship, I've been watching you on the station's sensors.

job.text: I'm the station's security analyst.  I protect the station from hacking attacks.  I also maintain the firewall and upgrade and install hacking systems in trusted ships.
job.label: Station Security

firewall.text: The firewall is like a shield that protects the station from Trad hacking attacks.

hacking attack.text: A hacking attack will temporarily freeze the enemy's combat system.  You can fly right by them, even flash them a big smile, and there's nothing they can do about it.

smile.text: Of course, if we're talking about a Frumptarian slothbeast, it's a creature with a beautiful smile, but nobody ever sees it because it's on the bottom of its foot.

feet.text: It's more like a snail's foot.

trusted.text: These are powerful systems we're talking about here.  What if someone told you they had the key to any lock on any door in the galaxy?  That's the kind of power I have.  I don't take that responsibility lightly.

responsibility.text: I haven't met very many responsible individuals around here.  Maybe I just did.  Time will tell I guess.

protect.text: Those Trad sirrahs are always attacking the station's firewall.  If you want to earn a bounty, you can ask me, any time.

sirrah.text: Don't you have a slang dictionary installed, sentient ship?  It actually comes from old term used to talk down to misbehaving children.  William Shakespeare, the great English playwrite used it in his plays.  Now we use it to mean any Trad - or anyone that helps them.  Of course, we would never use that word around a child now.  Not even a badly behaved one.

text: Sensors are detecting a hack attempt on one of the commmunication satellites.  The Nacktorbians are complaining that they can't watch the fleegle game.  Why don't you check it out?  I'll pay you 15 credits if you get the game back on.

Sensors are detecting another hack attempt on one of the commmunication satellites.  This time the Florbian 1,000 year knitting marathon is blurry.  Why don't you check it out?  I'll pay you 15 more credits if you get the marathon back on.

Sensors are detecting another hack attempt on one of the commmunication satellites.  This time it's the Raiders game.  You know how Raiders fans can be.  Why don't you check it out?  I'll pay you 15 more credits if you get the game back on.

Sensors are detecting another hack attempt on one of the commmunication satellites.  This time it's an old Taylor Swift concert that the Napapapatrons are into right now?  Why don't you check it out?  I'll pay you 15 more credits if you get the concert back on.

Sensors are detecting a hack attempt on one of the commmunication satellites.  I know you're probably getting tired of being the cable repairperson, but we can't seem to get anything on the entertainment comm signals at all?  Why don't you check it out?  I'll pay you 15 credits more if you get the entertainment array back on.

Sensors are detecting a hack attempt on one of the commmunication satellites.  This time it's pretty serious.  We can't communicate with any off-station systems.  We're completely radio silent.  Why don't you check it out?  I'm willing to pay you 30 credits, if you succeed.

Sensors are detecting a hack attempt on gravity control systems.  If this keeps up we're all going to start gaining some serious weight, if you know what I mean. Why don't you check it out?  I'm willing to pay you 30 credits, if you succeed.

Sensors are detecting a hack attempt on our solar arrays.  If it isn't stopped soon, engineering is going to have a hard time keeping the lights on around here.  Why don't you check it out?  I'm willing to pay you 30 credits, if you succeed.

Sensors are detecting a hack attempt on the station greenhouse systems.  We need to stop it before our important food crops die.  Why don't you check it out?  I'm willing to pay you 30 credits, if you succeed.

Sensors are detecting a hack attempt on our life support systems!  We need to stop it soon, or the station will need to be evacuated.  Why don't you check it out?  I'm willing to pay you 50 credits, if you succeed.

start.text: I am a very busy man.  Why have you disturbed me?

name.text: I am Landrite Cordoza, of course!
name.label: Landrite Cordoza

job.text: You haven't heard of me?  I am the human emissary to the Intergalactic Federation.
job.label: I.F. Emissary

Exelor.text: That planet is strictly off-limits unless you have the correct security clearance.  Of course, as an I.F. emmisary, I could prepare the paperwork for you.  I wouldn't do that for just anyone, though.  Only a true friend.

friend.text: My friends like to do things for me, and I like to do things for them.  I've got some work I need done right now, in fact, and I'm paying a bounty for it.
